Reviews.Title: “Great place for the world travelor @ a decent price!”
Reviews.Author: Tabs23cu
Reviews.Content: I love this little hotel in Ocean City, Md. I have traveled the world & been in countries & hotel rooms that were definitely different. My big three for hotel rooms are safety, cleanliness, & staff. I grew up coming down to the beaches here with my parents, always having a weeklong rental. Looking for a place to stay that I felt safe, had a decent room, & affordable price I found the surf villa! I mean don't expect a brand new hotel room where you'll be paying several hundred a night, but if you want a nice decent place with pleasant staff. I highly recommend staying here. I have been staying here for several summers & i always recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Different strokes for different folks.”
Reviews.Author: HelenTD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Surf Villa Hotel for many years now in different rooms upstairs and apartments as well. This place is charming and I consider it as my second home place. This is not for those who are looking for luxury place, do not expect high fashion modern facilities and amenities. This is an OLD hotel, it has it’s own HISTORY in it! There are just few buildings like that left in OC! And as for me every time we stay there the place is cleaned well, cozy atmosphere, with basic needs. The manager and staff are always friendly and caring. And moreover we love the location, love reading on the front porch, with the price they offer you cannot beat it. It worth the money you spend. And I suggest this place to all my friends and those who are interested in diving in history of Ocean City and emerging in the amiable atmosphere. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO THOSE WHO ARE TRYING TO GET THE PLACE FOR THE PRICE HOTEL GIVES (FRANKLY SPEAKING ONE OF THE CHEAPEST AMONG OC RENTALS) AND DEMAND HILTON STANDARDS!

Reviews.Title: “Crappy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dissatisfied610
Reviews.Content: The moment I saw the front door to our apartment I knew to lower my expectations of the room. The pictures on the website does not give the room justice. The 2 bedroom apartment is a hole in the wall, with the feel of a stingy basement. Windows are boarded up, very claustrophobic. The beds were made up but the mattresses are covered with some plastic cover which swishs every time you move. The sheets were stained. There is no cover sheet provided for the sofa sleepers. Bath towels are not provided, neither was bath soap. The bathroom is so small that you need to walk sideways. During our 3 night stay, housekeeping only came once and only cleaned the bathroom - nothing else. There were 6 of us but only received one key- one per room, the reception guy said. One positive is the proximity to the beach; half a block. You would need to be desperate to stay here!!!!! I WILL NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE NOT EVEN TO MY WORST ENEMY, IF I HAD ONE.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in OC...”
Reviews.Author: Kerry S
Reviews.Content: We love staying at Surf Villa! We found this family owned and operated hotel a few years back and have become faithful customers! The owner is friendly and always accommodating, the location is superb and you can't beat the price. It is close to the boardwalk and bus stops. It is a beach house that was converted into 2 downstairs apartments and regular hotel rooms upstairs with a big covered front porch. I have always found the rooms to be clean, when walking into the lobby it is always neat and smells like it was freshly cleaned...the sheets always smell freshly bleached. I have stayed in the upstairs rooms and the front apartment downstairs. The front apartment was remodeled this year and was very nice, and again...check the prices, you won't find anything in this great location for what they are charging. As far as other reviews saying it is a party spot...I personally stay at Surf Villa every year that same weekend, the Spring Car Cruisers weekend in May. Most of Ocean City is a party that weekend. The town is full of classic cars, and with that comes the burnouts all night long and in turn the visitors line the streets to watch this activity. The owner can't control who is on the public sidewalk near his property, that is the job of the O.C. police, and in my opinion they do a pretty good job of enforcing the laws. Bottom line, if you don't want a party type atmosphere then don't book ANYWHERE in O.C. for Cruisers week or Bike week for that matter, the same can be said for any other beach town. I personally find Surf Villa very cozy and charming, and I like the fact that it is owner operated. Hector is always good to us, and I look forward to seeing him again next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, Dump -- stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at many "budget" hotels in our time and we can overlook a lot, but in the end we just couldn't stay in this room. Disgusting doesn't even begin to cover it. Rooms are tiny and obviously haven't been renovated for 20+ years. The glass doorknob came off in my hand when we first entered the room. That was the first sign of things to come. The cable box was duct-taped to the tv and there were only 2 channels. The carpet on the floor was stained. I didn't even want to take my shoes off. But these things in and of themselves would not have been enough to chase us away. What sealed the deal for us was the absolute disgusting condition of the bathroom, the shower in particular. The shower smelled of mildew, the shower curtain rod was rusted and the water ran either scalding hot or cold - never warm. The water pressure wasn't adequate enough to even rinse the shampoo from hair, let alone the slimy feeling from just being in there. After my disgusting shower, my husband and I decided to leave and find another hotel. Of course the manager told us there were no refunds. But I contacted my credit card company and got an immediate chargeback due to the disgusting conditions. This place needs to be knocked down and rebuilt. I wouldn't allow farm animals to stay in this place. To be blunt, its not fit for human habitation. Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel but an inn”
Reviews.Author: gia_isa
Reviews.Content: First, the name is deceiving. It's not a hotel but more like an inn. Like another review said- the setup is akin to renting a room in someone's house. This place really needs to be remodeled. We booked a room with a queen size bed. The bed took up most of the room and honestly, the room was smaller than my room at home. The bed was one of those old spring beds where everytime you sit on it it squeaks. We showered in our flip flops because the shower floor was stained and we weren't sure if it was dirty or just stained. Also, the bathroom itself was really tiny and the window blinds were dirty and broken. From our room you could hear all the noise from the street. Pros: One block from beach, nice view from our window of the boardwalk, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, great location, free coffee in the morning, and of course, a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad!”
Reviews.Author: mkjczf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the spur of the moment > couldn't bare the thought of leaving and the price was right for an extra night's stay! This is an older place, but the room was huge with 2 double beds. Even tho it's an older place, with old fixtures and things, it was very clean. The only problem was that the shower temperature kept changing from very hot to very cold. Other than that, it was a fine stay. The manager guy is SUPER friendly and all of the staff we passed were very nice! For about 100 bucks in peak season, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: ARBEN1
Reviews.Content: The place was right and clean. The people were friendly and rooms were clean. The hotel is short distance to the ocean. The place is close to everything. Downtown is just a short distance tfrom this hotel. The place also ofered parking with a resonable price which made our stay more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: surfer080
Reviews.Content: First and last time ever spending time at the Surf Villa, arrived and found out I had to park 2 blocks away and pay for the parking when I was insured each room had a parking spot when I reserved the room. Got passed that and went to the room only to notice the toilet was backed up, very disgusting and would not flush. Got that taken cared of and noticed that the bathroom had all sorts of bugs crawling around and the shower was filthy. Want to go back to Ocean City but will never rent a room here again and would never recommend it. Very noisey, dirty and had no hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & Old Fashioned”
Reviews.Author: rschiera
Reviews.Content: Staying here now and place is great! Feels like I am in an old turn of the century hotel. Room is small but big enough for two. It's like staying at someones house and using the guest room. Read other reviews and don't get it. This place is clean, worn and has tons of charm. This is what coming to OC is all about. For those looking for Hilton type rooms, go there! If you like the concept of staying in someones house, then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “By far the worst hotel I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: sambratrent
Reviews.Content: It is cheap but, just remember you get what you pay for. When I first got there they let me check in 30 mins early which was nice but, i had to pay 10 dollars for parking. However I left for the beach right away when i came back my cable wasn't working so they tried to fix it and couldn't so we switch rooms. when we got to the other room it smelled like they sprayed 10 cans of Lysol my kids and i were choking and had to open all the windows for at least 3 hours before we could stand the smell. Then I got home and was looking at the website and noticed on the amenities that there was free parking one space per room. When i called to get a refund they refused to give me one and said that it was only for some rooms, and you only get it if you make phone reservations. By far the worst hotel i have stayed in OC.

Reviews.Title: “Surge the extra money and stay somewhere sanitary”
Reviews.Author: nasty123
Reviews.Content: I'm at this hotel right now, smoking a cigarette outside, its where I spend most of my time here since our room is so small and run down. Seriously it looks like an abandoned house with chipped walls, crooked floors and ceilings, rusted leaky fixtures, ancient furnishings, etc. The so called cable tv has ZERO channels that aren't infomercials. The air conditioner is noisy and sounds like its going to explode, the bathroom is tiny, the shower is tiny, Ohh and forget about even having friends come chill in your room, they aren't allowed. Then there's the outdoor "community kitchen" which is absolutely atrocious and smells like rotting meat. It's a block to the beach which is pretty cool but honestly the owner of this craphole should tear it down and build something decent.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Time”
Reviews.Author: Eddie41199
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Surf Villa Hotel for three nights in mid August 2010. I really loved the location of the hotel. I love the ocean and the hotel is very close to the beach. The service was great in hotel and the room I stayed was clean, no complains. Housekeepers sometimes had difficulties understanding what I was asking, but it’s not a big deal cause there was always someone to help in the lobby. Of course the building is historical, but as for me I prefer small hotels, cause they bring special home or family atmosphere to the entire time of staying. Besides people who work there are always nice and welcoming. All in all my vacation was really enjoyable. My goal was to see as much as I can and enjoy every minute of my stay. And I can admit the hotel worth the money I spent. I managed to get all fun of OC and same time save money.

Reviews.Title: “Surf Villa is going downhill”
Reviews.Author: dre329usa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Surf Villa from Thurs – Sun for Sunfest weekend 2010. I was very disappointed. My last 2 stays previous to this were average. I had upstairs rooms that were adequate, and while I could complain about those stays, I’ll focus on the most recent one. This was my 3rd stay there and this one constituted the last. I got a lobby level room that was fairly small, but the size wasn’t an issue. My major gripes: 1) the floor was filthy; I wore white socks for just a few minutes and they turned black! 2) the furnishings were terribly aged 3) the mattress was sagging in the middle and in dire need of replacement 4) the window-mounted A/C was barely adequate 5) the electric socket (only 1) in the bathroom was too small to fit anything modern into 6) the toilet took 3 flushes to get anything down 7) the faucets in the bathroom required tremendous torque to stop the leaking 8) was only supplied a bare number of towels/washcloths 9) maybe 2-3 hangers in the closet, and they were all mangled and old 10) the television set was set on a stand way too high to watch comfortably. So if you have a few extra dollars, seek out another hotel or motel. In my opinion, this place has gone downhill so much in the last few years.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not the best”
Reviews.Author: skoors2008
Reviews.Content: When we got there, there was no place to park. When you check in you get a parking pass for the lot behind the hotel, which has room for 8 cars and which is first come first serve and for parking at the comfort inn 2 blocks down. You have to walk up the steps to check in and if your room is upstairs you have to walk up the tiny stair case. Not recommended for people with walking disabilities. The doors are hard to lock; they lock by bolt lock, which in order to lock the door has to be pulled up and in. when you walk in the room that's basically it. I had a single queen bed which was the most uncomfortable thing I have ever slept in. There was a whole in the center of the mattress so you would roll to the center if you were in the bed with someone else. The sheets had stains but I brought my own. The TV is a 19 inch mounted on the wall so no way to hook up a game system if you were looking to. When you walk in the bathroom the door doesn't open far enough because the toilet is in the way and the shower is large enough to turn in and that is basically it. Before the stay i read the reviews and I was a bit scared but it wasn't as bad. I called and made sure my room had a bathroom and they told me all of them had private bathrooms so I’m guessing they were recently added. I didn't let them clean the room but after the third day a girl brought me towels but when I asked for toilet paper she didn't understand what I was asking, and there is always someone in the lobby. If you would like internet access your S.O.L unless you want to sit on the computer in the lobby. I was on the second floor and there was none! The walls were paper thin when vacuuming in another room down the hall it sounded like it was right next door. But my room wasn't so bad, I would stay again if it was only for a couple nights, it's only a block from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Again...Very Unsafe Place..Especially with Young Children”
Reviews.Author: ssae2005
Reviews.Content: The first day of our first family vacation with our 2 and 3 year olds turned into a nightmare!! We arrive at the Surf Villa and find no place to park to even check in...No problem...can totally deal with that! Normal for the beach. We arrive in the room to find it smaller than expected (can deal with that too) BUT CANNOT deal with nails poking out of the walls....paint chipping and peeling all over the floor....extension cords hanging everywhere...and wait..I am not don....The window had a busted out screen with NO LOCK on it...perfect for toddlers..huh??!! The staff found nothing wrong with any of this?!! We were told we "get what you paid for." Maybe we missed something..but we were not intending to pay for our children to be in danger with no window...paint all over and nails poking out of the walls. I have several pictures to post and plan on doing so soon...I just wanted to get this out there as soon as possible to prevent other families from experiencing the hell and loss of money that we did.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe the online photos!!”
Reviews.Author: monet88
Reviews.Content: After I looked at their website and saw the photos of the bedrooms, I had confidence that this hotel would be a great place for me and my boyfriend. The rooms looked presentable and they looked decent in size. Well they fooled me. When we arrived, the rooms looked nothing like the photos. My boyfriend and I were so disappointed. The only thing we like about the hotel was its location, being a block away from the boardwalk. The first thing we did once we calmed down was lysol everything that we would possibly have to come in contact with. Just the presence of the room made us feel uncomfortable as if the room was infected. The room was the size of my bedroom and the bathroom was the size of my mother's closet! The remote to the ac did not work so we were unable to adjust the settings. The sheets had stains on them. Thank God I always travel with my own bedding. We immediately lysoled the bed down and covered the bed with my own bedding, leaving the hotel's bedding on the floor. The floor had multiple stains on them which made the room appear even more unsanitary. The shower head was rusted and the shower floor tiling was chipped. The bathroom sink had to faucets. One for hot water and one for cold water which means you can never have warm water! Its either you turn on the cold or the hot water. I have never felt so uncomfortable in a hotel in my life. We were so germaphobic that weekend that we had to laugh at ourselves. I am so glad that I came prepared with my big spray of lysol. It helped us feel somewhat more comfortable but we still felt disgusted being in that room. I would never advise anyone to stay at this hotel unless they are ok with dealing with the circumstances that we dealth with. Do not believe the pictures on their website. The only thing that matched the photos in the website with the actual rooms was the quilt on the bed. The queen bed that we slept on looked like the full size bed that I have in my bedroom. Also, since when does a hotel not have a telephone in the bedrooms? There was not telephone, no blowdryer, and no outlets in the bathroom to curl your hair or blow dry it. To top it all off, the rooms are not sound proof at all. We could hear everything from the people outside to the housekeepers spraying the rooms in the morning. It sick and I would never in my life return to this hotel again. Please believe me when I tell you, this place needs to be knocked down and built all over again into an updated comfortable hotel. What I find very funny is that I had read the reviews online prior to my arrival but I had already made my reservations. I wish I had read the reviews before I made my reservations...I learned my lesson though.

Reviews.Title: “The owners welcomed us into their home and made us feel like family.”
Reviews.Author: julstreet
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place. The location is perfect. When you get there, be sure to say "hi" to Hektor the Protector and offer the man a margarita.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Anebolyn
Reviews.Content: The location was great and the staff was very nice. The room was not the best but for the money, I can't complain too much. The really bad part was that the shower had a hot water leak that was scalding so I was therefore afraid to bathe my children. Also, the walls were very thin and we could hear the other guests, and their crying children! The community kitchen was DISGUSTING and smelled very foul!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jhendrick2662
Reviews.Content: The surf villa was a dream come true. Right when my 9 closest friends and i arrived at the villa we had a great time. The rooms were nice the people were nice and the time was even better. The ocean is not far away (but we didn't leave the apt. very long) the atmosphere at the villa was worth every penny. I believe that the surf villa was the best place i have evered stayed. It felt like home away from home. I give it a huge five stars out of five., if you could give it six stars i would.
